name: Au sourire de Montmartre

reviews.text: I spent here 2 nights during a business trip. It is a fantastic place to stay, absolutely quiet rooms, clean with a very good bed. A warm welcome by the owner family gave me a first proof that I made a very good choice. The breakfast is nice with fresh croissants and ficelles, marmelade, yaourt, fruitjuice and a very good coffee. Iz is also situated very good as during leisure time you find quickly a good reaturant nearby or you walk to the dome des invalides in a few minutes where you can enjoy a wonderful panormaa. It has not been my last stay in this B&B.
reviews.title: A feeling like at home

reviews.text: We visited this B&B from the U.S. There were 4 of us; including mom who is 81. We rented both rooms on the ground floor.
reviews.title: We had a wonderful time.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the B&B is fantastic. It is literally less than 5 minutes from Jules Joffrin metro stop. That line could get us to anywhere in Paris - including linking out the Versailles line. We have discovered several great restaurants in the area, and there are local drug stores, grocery stores, and other services available.
reviews.title: Pretty disappointing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both rooms were spotless. In fact, this is the first B&B we have been to that cleans your room every day. Both rooms had steam showers, and the showers had lots of pressure and lots of hot water and were spotlessly clean.
reviews.title: Wonderful Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both rooms had queen size beds, and one of the rooms also had a kitchen sink, stove, microwave, and small fridge.
reviews.title: Great, great, great
Wonderful Stay
reviews.text: First the neighborhood, The location is within a minute walk to the metro. A great bakery is two minutes away. The neighboorhood always felt safe.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The B&B, I stayed here for one week with a friend and then by myself. I appreciated the security of the place as I felt safe. There was no issues with my stay and the host was incredible. We were served wine upon our arrival and she showed us on a map where we were and what is around us.
reviews.title: Out of Town but convenient base

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would stay here again anytime I was in Paris. It was just as beautiful as the pictures.
reviews.title: A disappointing experience

reviews.text: We stayed here for 3 nights and found it comfortable. The room space was a little small and a little on the dark side as we only had one small window facing into an enclosed courtyard, The en-suite shower room was excellent, very powerful and hot shower.
reviews.title: A gem in Montmartre

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room had an IMac computer with a large screen and free internet which was very useful as it meant we could stream a film to watch in bed after an evening out.
reviews.title: Nice locations but Unbearable sewer smell

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just returned from a wonderful weekend in Paris. Ilhame made us feel very much at home and couldn't have been more helpful. There is a little booklet in the room that says their aim was to create a home from home and this couldn't have been more true. Rooms were modern, bed comfortable, breakfast tasty and Ilhame very helpful with how to get about in town.
reviews.title: Wonderful little B&B in pretty neighbourhood

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We made enquiries months in advance and Ilhame was already full. She offered us a little studio with kitchenette which doesn't appear on her website. We arrived early in the morning on the train and we were welcomed with breakfast.
reviews.title: A convivial, local sort of Paris

reviews.text: At busy times - and this certainly was one such time - there's a certain amount of bustle and you have to be ready to share your breakfast table with other (frequently interesting) people. Moreover, in the room, there was a big-screen Mac computer and wi-fi but no hairdryer or a larger mirror.
reviews.title: A Real Gem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However we got exactly what we wanted: a personal, friendly, homely experience for a very reasonable price rather than a functional, anonymous hotel.
reviews.title: Quaint, small and friendly B&B, steps from Sacre Coeur

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Every morning there was great coffee, tea, fresh fruit straight out of a still life painting, moreish bread, yogurt and a tasty round of hot croque-monsieur. Most important of all, there were plenty of smiles and chats too and you can't put a price on that.
reviews.title: A very cosy stay in the heart of Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is without a doubt the nicest B&B we have ever stayed at. The location in Montmartre is perfect and the room was lovely and tastefully decorated. What really makes this B&B so special is Ilhames hospitality and friendly nature. She takes great care of her guests. This is especially noticeable in the delicious and generous breakfasts she prepares every morning. We can strongly recommend Au sourire de Montmartre to anyone looking for a romantic stay in Paris!
reviews.title: The nicest B&B we have ever stayed at!

reviews.text: My 14 yr old daughter and I visited France for the first time ever. I was looking for a place that would be safe, reasonably priced, clean with a Parisian flavor to it. This is it! Sourire was excellent! The rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. Ilhame's breakfast is wonderful. Fresh jams, baguette, croissants, ham and cheese sandwiches gave us energy for powerwalking the morning's events. The free internet is quite helpful. It is located close to Brasseries and the Sacre Coeur Basilica. Ilhame gave us good suggestions with our daily activities. Bus #80 takes you directly to the Eiffel Tower. The Jules Joffrin metro stop is super close by. We had a fantastic time with truly a quaint and charming place to stay!
reviews.title: Charming Home Away From Home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved our stay at the Sourire. Staff are super friendly and helpful. The rooms are nicely decorated and have computers for those who are travelling laptop-less. Only minus would be the steep stairs to reach the breakfast room at the top floor....but to think on the positive side it made me feel less guilty to eat all those homemade croissants and jams ;)
reviews.title: Friendliest people in Paris

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: They have steep stairs so if you have heavy luggages, better request for a room nearest to the ground. The room that we got was a Moroccan theme and it was really nice! Bed was soft and cozy. Breakfast was really good. They had home-made jams, crispy (and also fluffy) croissant, baguettes, juice, everything you want for a french breakfast. The place is near Jules Joffrin metro stop and is close to different restaurants. Overall, we're happy with the place!
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.text: Really enjoyed my stay here - lovely hostess and very nice room. However, I do feel it is quite overpriced for the area. It can also be quite noisy because of the wooden staircase which means that a lie-in can be a challenge. That said, the only thing that would make me think twice about recommending this place is the price. It is the most expensive B&B I've ever stayed in by some way, so naturally I had high expectations - but I don't think the experience necessarily reflects the price.
reviews.title: Lovely B&B, but perhaps a bit over-priced

description: Welcome to Ilhame's Bed and Breakfast, on the doorstep of “Amelie Poulain’s” Montmartre. If you are looking for an authentic Parisian experience, and want to feel "at home in Paris", this is the place to stay!You can choose from a selection of five luxury B&B rooms with their own "en-suite" bathroom. Each bedroom has been tastefully decorated, all with their authentic and unique style. Influences from our French and Morocan origins can easily be recognized around the Bed & Breakfast.
